title: Useful git stuff
text: Because every now and then there is this thing you need to do with git, but because you do it not so often, you have to google it for like 30 sec.

title: Useful git stuff
text:
Useful git commands
To create a new empty branch:
git switch --orphan <new branch>
git commit --allow-empty -m "Initial commit on orphan branch"
git push -u origin <new branch>
source

title: Useful pandas stuff
text:
import pandas as pd
s = pd.Series(pd.date_range("20130101", periods=4, freq='H'))
s

0   2013-01-01 00:00:00
1   2013-01-01 01:00:00
2   2013-01-01 02:00:00
3   2013-01-01 03:00:00
dtype: datetime64[ns]


Keep just the date:

s.dt.date

0    2013-01-01
1    2013-01-01
2    2013-01-01
3    2013-01-01
dtype: object


Keep just the date as datetime object:

s.dt.date.astype('datetime64')

0   2013-01-01
1   2013-01-01
2   2013-01-01
3   2013-01-01
dtype: datetime64[ns]


Keep just the date by resetting the timestamp:

s.dt.normalize()

0   2013-01-01
1   2013-01-01
2   2013-01-01
3   2013-01-01
dtype: datetime64[ns]


Keep the date with a particular formatting:

s.dt.strftime("%Y/%m/%d")

0    2013/01/01
1    2013/01/01
2    2013/01/01
3    2013/01/01
dtype: object


Links:
- source
- .dt docs
